headline: Ask HN: High Biases in Stripe-Radar?
description:
Following high (10.57%) USD-INR transaction fee on PayPal [1]. We, recently, implemented Stripe payments and found that the Stripe-Radar is hindering the subscriptions. Yesterday, we experienced 2-digit "Blocked" payments because of "High Risk". I upgraded my account to see the reasoning, after evaluating the failures it seems the Stripe-Radar is highly biased to the distance between payment-session-ip-address and card-billing-address.

A card transaction with an 11-mile distance & no history of frauds/disputes has a RiskScore of 87. The transaction is blocked as the account by default comes with RiskScore threshold of 75.

There are "Allow Rules" on the Stripe-Radar, that are disabled as the account should meet 2K USD/month. We have been consistently doing over 15K USD/month on other gateways, and Stripe doesn't want to consider the transactions statement to enable the option for new accounts.

Has anyone come across a similar situation? How did you handle it?

[1]. https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=32228267
description_zh-Hans:
继PayPal的高额（10.57%）美元-印度卢比交易费之后[1]。我们，最近，实施了Stripe支付，并发现Stripe-Radar阻碍了订阅的进行。昨天，我们遇到了2位数的"阻止"支付，因为"高风险"。我升级了我的账户以查看原因，在评估了失败的原因后，似乎Stripe-Radar对支付会话ip地址和卡账单地址之间的距离有很大的偏见。

一个有11英里距离的卡交易& 没有欺诈/纠纷的历史，风险分数为87。

在Stripe-Radar上有"Allow Rules"，这些规则被禁用，因为该账户应达到每月2千美元。我们一直在其他网关上做超过15000美元/月的交易，而Stripe不想考虑交易报表来启用新账户的选项。

有人遇到过类似情况吗？你是怎么处理的？

[1]. https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=32228267
